bio: I'm Melvin Prince, a passionate full-stack developer with 5+ years of experience creating modern web applications. I specialize in React, Next.js, and TypeScript, with a strong focus on performance optimization, accessibility, and user experience. I'm currently working as a Senior Frontend Developer at TechCorp Inc., where I lead development for SaaS applications serving 100k+ users.

faq.a: I have 4+ years of experience with React, including hooks, context, and modern patterns. I've built numerous production applications and am well-versed in performance optimization and best practices.
Yes! TypeScript is my preferred choice for any medium to large project. I've been using it for 3+ years and appreciate the type safety and developer experience it provides.
I work primarily with Node.js and Express for backend development, along with databases like PostgreSQL and MongoDB. I also have experience with Python and FastAPI for API development.

faq.q: Are you available for freelance work?
faq.a: I'm currently open to interesting freelance projects and consulting opportunities. Feel free to reach out through the contact form to discuss your project needs.
Accessibility is a core part of my development process. I follow WCAG guidelines, implement proper semantic HTML, keyboard navigation, and screen reader support from the start of every project.

faq.q: Do you have experience with animations?
faq.a: Yes! I work with both Framer Motion for React animations and GSAP for more complex scroll-triggered animations. I always ensure animations respect user preferences like prefers-reduced-motion.
My go-to stack is Next.js with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS for styling, and either PostgreSQL with Prisma or MongoDB for data. For deployment, I typically use Vercel or AWS.

faq.q: How do you handle performance optimization?
faq.a: I focus on Core Web Vitals, implement proper code splitting, optimize images with next/image, use dynamic imports for heavy libraries, and monitor performance with tools like Lighthouse.
